attributes.action: recognise specifically that chronic pain and chronic fatigue cause incapacity for work
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Sufferers of chronic fatigue syndrome, fibromyalgia, hypermobility syndrome, and other such chronic conditions can go through periods when their ability to function is severely impaired. The current rules for claiming ESA do not recognise the validity of myalgia, arthralgia, malaise or severe sleep disruption. This causes distress and humiliation for sufferers who are often forced to appeal decisions, or to work when unfit thereby causing themselves further health problems. We ask that this family of incapacities be correctly recognised so that people who experience chronic pain and chronic fatigue can claim ESA when they need it.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to recognise specifically that chronic pain and chronic fatigue cause incapacity for work.

Her Majesty's Government has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.hmg.gov.uk/epetition-responses/petition-view.aspx?epref=chronicpain
